results.title: The Indian Pacific
results.creator_credit: Ron Bollman, Cathy Beitz and Banksia Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great train journeys of Australia”.
Traverse the full distance between the Indian and Pacific Oceans, from Sydney to Perth, in a 2,700 mile odyssey. One of the world’s great long distance trains, the Indian Pacific, rolls across Australia like a miniature city on wheels, illuminating the colorful and quirky history, cultures and countryside of Australia as it goes. The heart of the Outback emerges in the Nullarbor Plain, offering a glimpse into the oldest continuing culture on earth. We stop several times along the way and meet the people who have made the remote outback their home. The three day journey on Australia’s crown jewel of rail lines promises all that the country itself has to offer - vivid landscapes, exotic creatures, mystical destinations, and unforgettable characters. Presented in two parts: Sydney to Adelaide and Adelaide to Perth.

group_siblings.title: The Queenslander: tales of the tropical north

results.title: The XPT East Coast journey
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great train journeys of Australia”.
On the Express Passenger Train- Australia’s fastest train, travel from Brisbane in subtropical Queensland to cosmopolitan Sydney in the heart of New South Wales. Cross the rugged Macpherson ranges, tour Australia’s economic heartland and visit the country’s pristine beaches. The XPT even cruises through some alternative villages and through Australia’s spectacular rainforests. As the train pulls into one of its 21 stops, Coff’s Harbour, view the vast plantations of bananas as well as the gaudy “Big Banana” tourist park, which symbolizes the recent tourism boom. Finally, the XPT reaches Sydney. Hugging the shores of a magnificent harbor and accented by its elegant bridge, Sydney is the quintessential icon of the Australian experience.

results.title: Australian made
results.creator_credit: Richard Lowenstein, Jill Bilcock, John McLean, Captured Live Productions and Tom Hegarty Productions
results.brief_description: Australian music came of age in the summer of 1987 when the cream of Oz rock swept the continent for the most ambitious series of open air concerts ever staged beneath the Southern Cross. Almost 140,000 fans in six cities were entertained with a diverse array of potent and imaginative rock - from understated avant-garde to tempestuous thunder from Down Under. The dynamic performances and behind-the-scenes activity of the tour has generated an exciting, fast paced and imaginative feature film. Includes performances by: INXS ; Jimmy Barnes ; The Triffids ; I’m Talking ; The Saints ; The Divinyls and The Models.

results.title: Bitter Herbs and Honey
results.creator_credit: Monique Schwarz, Amber Films and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: Australian documentary focuses on the lives of European Jews who settled in the Melbourne suburb of Carlton in the 1940s, fleeing World War II atrocities and post-War conditions. Interestingly the Jews from Eastern Europe clashed with Anglo-Jews, settled in the nineteenth century, who identified as British rather than Jewish and disapproved of the too obvious presence of Sephardic Jews, with whom they feared association. Despite these and other difficulties, social groups thrived in the suburb, where people shared life, food, religion and a common experience. Local residents from the period, many recalling their childhood, discuss a marvellously rich and joyous, if impoverished, family life; others talk about the racism suffered at school and in the street; several recount the pain of being a Holocaust survivor and the trials of assimilation. Includes archival footage from the era interspersed with recreations and a slew of interviews that include: Pinchus Ringelblum, Hilary Rubinstein, Bernard Rechter, Solomon Pose, Victor Smorgon, Arnord Zable, Jean Holkner, June Factor, Freydi Mrocki, Sam Lipski, Amirah Inglis, Rachel Levita and Miriam Kuna. Features some marvellous Yiddish songs and several interviewees discuss their parents yearning to sustain the use of Yiddish language. With occasional English subtitles.

results.title: Operation Blue Whale
results.brief_description: On May 5th 1992 a dead nineteen metre Blue whale was washed ashore on the South Coast of Victoria. This video documents the challenges faced by the Museum of Victoria in retrieving the carcass, and the preparation of the skeleton for permanent exhibition at the Museum. Photography, music and narration by Dr David Smith. Rights held by Dr David Smith.

results.title: Skyhooks: the video collection
results.creator_credit: Christina Pozzan, Ray Argall and Musical Films
results.brief_description: Traces the history of Melbourne pop group ‘Skyhooks’ using video clips, concert footage, backstage interviews and segments from Australian television in the 70’s and 80’s. Formed in 1973, Skyhooks quickly acquired popularity amongst youths, while simultaneously arousing controversy in conservative Australia. This compilation tape presents 19 of their songs drawn from concerts, and video clips interspersed with television appearances, newspaper clippings and interviews.

results.title: Out
results.brief_description: Initially following the trajectory of a car which is taking ‘The Girl’ (Celia Ireland), out to a social function, this short film allows the viewer to be privy to the thought processes of what it means to go “out”. The girl ponders issues such as timing, kissing, a no sex policy, being interesting, making an impression, pit stops, and identifying the highlight of the evening. Cast also includes John Polson and Suzy Dougherty.

results.title: As a matter of fact: a film about abortion
results.creator_credit: Robyn Dryen, Susan Lambert, Creative Development Branch of Australian Film Commission, Women's Health Resources Foundation and Womens Film Fund
results.brief_description: A documentary about a feminist run abortion clinic. Counselling is shown to be an important part of the procedure, which is carried out using local anaesthetic and the vacuum aspiration method. We follow one woman through the termination of her pregnancy, and other women tell why they chose to have an abortion. The film ends with an animated section on the struggle for free, legalised abortion in Australia and information on what to do and where to go if you are pregnant.

results.title: [Royal guest XVI Olympiad 1956]
results.brief_description: A historical record of Prince Philip’s visit to Melbourne during the 1956 Olympic Games. Captures his airport arrival; the public lining Melbourne’s streets to greet the Prince; his visit to Government House; a parade on Swanston street showing a glimpse of Melbourne Town Hall; the opening ceremony at Olympic Games; Robert Menzies and Prince Philip arriving at the Olympic stadium; entrance of athletes at the opening ceremony; Ron Clarke’s memorable entrance into the stadium and the lighting of the Olympic flame; footage of Station Pier in Port Melbourne; Philip arriving at St Paul’s cathedral in Melbourne; an extensive tour of the accomodation facilities prepared for the athletes at Olympic Village in Heidelberg; Philip visit a hospital and the Australian Paper Manufacturers mill in Heidelberg; shows footage of various track and field events in the stadium; a ceremony at Melbourne’s Shrine of Rememberance; the departure of Prince Philip.

results.title: The Adventures of Floss the Fairy and Riddley Robot: the letter Z runs away
results.brief_description: Written and produced by an Early Childhood teacher in Queensland, this tape is aimed at assisting young children in developing literacy and numeracy skills. The video is interactive, allowing young children to discover and learn through literacy and numeracy experiences, and the fantasy story encompasses songs that are supported by 3D visual effects, thus creating a fun learning environment that further develops confidence and success. Areas covered include; spatial and positional word vocabulary and relationships, numbers, the alphabet, fine motor movements, self esteem, music and movement. ‘The Adventures of Floss the Fairy and Riddley Robot’ will entertain and educate children aged 7 months to 7 years.
